summary: This is a brief email from a US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) sender to an unspecified recipient, forwarding or referencing a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein and asking 'How are we putting down our marker?' The document suggests internal discussion within the US Attorney's Office regarding their public or legal position on the Epstein case in November 2018.

events.title: NYT Article on Epstein Prompts Internal US Attorney Email
events.description: An article about Jeffrey Epstein is published in the New York Times, prompting an email from within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing how to 'put down our marker'.

keyFacts: The email originates from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) on November 30, 2018.
The email references a New York Times article published that day about Jeffrey Epstein.
The core question posed is 'How are we putting down our marker?', indicating internal deliberation about the office's public or legal stance regarding Epstein.
The document number is EFTA00015347, and it is part of a larger released data set.
